column4: how do i unmount my xp harddrives? when i attempt to do so says i need root access how do i gain the access needed to unmount them?
it would be even better if i could disable  the desktop icons
you dont want the mounted volumes to show on the desktop?
open gconf-editor... go to apps -- nautilus -- desktop. In the right panel just uncheck volumes visible
sorry for the late reply i don't want them to show up on my desktop but i want them to still be mounted
right... my solution will help. I feel the same too
thank you very much you rock
if you go to the System menu and click "Help and Support" you will find lots of interesting stuff there..
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ -- there's fun stuff here too
can you check out my issue when you get a chance..  is thier a quick fix to back and foward in firefox.. it works in everything but firefox
what;s wrong with the back and forward in firefox?
alt+left arrow or right arrow doesn't work?
oh.. your mouse doesnt work.. interesting. I have no clue. that is indeed weird
